intro: Sedum fabarium, commonly known as the common stonecrop, is a succulent plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It features fleshy, upright stems and leaves that are typically green or reddish in color. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow or white during the summer months. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens and dry landscapes. Sedum fabarium is valued for its drought tolerance and ornamental appeal.
